talk.author: did:plc:depsg2otv7nbo2ca2z5iqopi
talk.utter:
Is it ok if I ask about what the "listen to spoken japanese" is??

Bc I want to do more listening but I don't really know where to start

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: You can start with anything you like really!!! Your fave games, movies, anime, shows in japanese are good. You probably won't understand a lot of it or any of it at first but that is FINE and NORMAL 🙏 It made me think back to when I was a tiny baby and didn't understand english yet

talk.author: did:plc:depsg2otv7nbo2ca2z5iqopi
talk.utter:
When watching for listening should I watch without subs?? 

Because I tried watching anime that I like and was very hit or miss, maybe bc it was a little too hard haha 

But once I tried watching Blue Box with japanese subs and it was great. Also first time seeing, but I only saw one episode

talk.author: did:plc:depsg2otv7nbo2ca2z5iqopi
talk.utter:
When watching for listening should I watch without subs?? 

Because I tried watching anime that I like and was very hit or miss, maybe bc it was a little too hard haha 

But once I tried watching Blue Box with japanese subs and it was great. Also first time seeing, but I only saw one episode

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter:
Personally I think yeah, without subs. It'll be really hard to understand at first, for like months to a year, but if you do it every day your brain will pick up on it like how it did your native language!!! 

EEE YES good it's awesome you've found something you're enjoying this way!!!!!!

talk.author: did:plc:depsg2otv7nbo2ca2z5iqopi
talk.utter:
I'll try to practice listening everyday, though I kinda struggle with consistency

Thanks for the advice :)
